CallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `callback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and the default is POST.

CallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call using the `callback_method` when the status of the eSIM Profile changes. At this stage of the eSIM Profile pilot, the a request to the URL will only be called when the ESimProfile resource changes from `reserving` to `available`.

Eid.description: Identifier of the eUICC that will claim the eSIM Profile.

GenerateMatchingId.description: When set to `true`, a value for `Eid` does not need to be provided. Instead, when the eSIM profile is reserved, a matching ID will be generated and returned via the `matching_id` property. This identifies the specific eSIM profile that can be used by any capable device to claim and download the profile.

$ul: **account_sid**: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) to which the eSIM Profile resource belongs.
**activation_code**: Combined machine-readable activation code for acquiring an eSIM Profile with the Activation Code download method. Can be used in a QR code to download an eSIM profile.
**date_created**: The date and time in GMT when the resource was created specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
**date_updated**: The date and time in GMT when the resource was last updated specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
**eid**: Identifier of the eUICC that can claim the eSIM Profile.
**error_code**: Code indicating the failure if the download of the SIM Profile failed and the eSIM Profile is in `failed` state.
**error_message**: Error message describing the failure if the download of the SIM Profile failed and the eSIM Profile is in `failed` state.
**iccid**: The [ICCID](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subscriber_identity_module#ICCID) associated with the Sim resource.

**matching_id**: Unique identifier of the eSIM profile that can be used to identify and download the eSIM profile from the SM-DP+ server. Populated if `generate_matching_id` is set to `true` when creating the eSIM profile reservation.
**sid**: The unique string that we created to identify the eSIM Profile resource.
**sim_sid**: The SID of the [Sim](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iot/supersim/api/sim-resource) resource that this eSIM Profile controls.
**smdp_plus_address**: Address of the SM-DP+ server from which the Profile will be downloaded. The URL will appear once the eSIM Profile reaches the status `available`.
**url**: The absolute URL of the eSIM Profile resource.
